front.p: 1897 July 27: to Warren Private collection, Colin Ashby.

body.p: I have just received your note of this day, in which you inform me of your intended visit on Thursday or Friday next, with your friend from England.—

Under existing circumstances, I regret very much to have to say, that I shall scarcely be able to receive you—for I am still very weak and cannot enter into any long or deep conversation. I returned on Friday last, noon, leisurely travelling by stages, but have not since been over my door step: and yesterday I told Dr. de Lisle, that I did not wish to see any one until I was stronger: and that I have even thought of putting an advertisement in our Papers—to request friends not to call.—
Moreover, pressing business (already too long delayed) will take me to town on Thursday morning next if fine,—or, if not fine on that day, then on Friday morning.
Were it otherwise with me I should be most happy to see you and your friend.

I am, Dear Sir,
Yours faithy.,
W. Colenso.
